data.title: Genealogy.com
data.meta_description: Family Tree Maker user home page for Francis-M-Butcher.
data.text:
Notes for SOLOMAN BUTCHER:

bur. Butcher Cem., Lew. Co., WV.

SOLOMON BUTCHER was the eighth child of PAULSER AND ELIZABETH

(BUSH) BUTCHER. He was born April 29, 1790 and died April 12, 1879.

There is no record that he ever married and ample supposition that

as a young man he ventured away to unknown destinations to later

return to Lewis County, West Virginia where he was born - and died.

He is buried in the Butcher Cemetery at Turnertown - about three miles

below Weston, on the West Fork River.

He was willed $30 by his father, Paulser, to be paid " if he ever

returns. "Nothing further is known about Solomon Butcher.

One report says he lived with aunt Caty, who was his brother Henry's

wife and lived on the old Butcher homestead.

FAMILY REFERENCE POINT : SOLOMON BUTCHER was the great, great, great,

uncle of Galelma, Jr., and Byron Thomas Butcher - and Dana L.

Thomason, Sr., and his brothers and sisters.

Notes for WILLIAM BUTCHER:

William Butcher died prior to the will of his father, Paulser Butcher, will datedJuly 19, 1829. William was not mentioned in the will.

Further, in review of the Butcher records at Weston, his name is not associated with any transaction involving any other members of his family. Therefore, he must have died early in life and in all probability is buried in the Butcher Cemetery, which undoubtedly was established by his father on the river bank, almost in sight of their home.
